document_data.caption: A dire hawk being used as a [[mount]] by a [[Moonsea skysentinel]].
document_data.name: Dire Hawk
document_data.mainbody: A '''dire hawk''' was a much larger and more powerful version of a [[hawk]].
document_data.Description: A typical dire hawk was {{SI|5|ft|c|long=yes}} long and had a {{SIAdj|11|ft|adj=long}} wingspan, They had bony protrusions on the top of their beaks and long trailing tail feathers.
document_data.Abilities: Dire hawks had excellent vision, just like their smaller cousins, and the [[Low-light vision|ability to see in dim light]]. They were incredibly strong, dexterous, robust and were swift fliers.
document_data.Behavior: These birds of prey hunted animals up to the size of a small [[horse]], including [[pig]]s and [[sheep]].
document_data.Combat: The exceptionally strong creatures had no trouble taking down their prey, raking with their sharp talons and biting.
document_data.Ecology: They were known to nest in large groups, close to the [[Dragonspine Mountains]].
document_data.History:
Particularly large specimens of dire hawks were employed by the [[Moonsea skysentinel]]s as aerial scouts and were made part of their military tactics, such as swooping in, attacking foes, and then flying away at a quick pace.

Such dire hawks were loyal to their masters, carrying them in combat or fighting side-by-side. Some of them had close relationships with [[druid]]s, such as [[Joatra Stelmar]].
